body:
Experiencing the same. Related : #6597 

Before the update. The errors object could have an unknown/undefined type but the object would still be populated when running the server.

Now the object has an unknown type and is not populated at all.

@williamviktorsson Thanks. I thought I was going off the deep end.

> Now the object has an unknown type and is not populated at all

"is not populated at all" -- is that the same as me saying, above...

> The `export let form: ActionData` never seems to get populated after an invalid submission. 

... or something else?

> ... or something else?

I tried the following assuming that might be the case.

```html
<!-- +page.svelte -->
<script lang="ts">
	export let form: any; // undefined
	export let data: any;  // {}
	export let errors: any; // undefined
</script>

```
Can't rerproduce the type issue, will push a fix for the `form` props issue.

issue.title: [fix] pass `form` prop to pages
issue.body:
Fixes #6610
Was not passed to pages in all situations

### Please don't delete this checklist! Before submitting the PR, please make sure you do the following:
- [x] It's really useful if your PR references an issue where it is discussed ahead of time. In many cases, features are absent for a reason. For large changes, please create an RFC: https://github.com/sveltejs/rfcs
- [x] This message body should clearly illustrate what problems it solves.
- [ ] Ideally, include a test that fails without this PR but passes with it.

### Tests
- [x] Run the tests with `pnpm test` and lint the project with `pnpm lint` and `pnpm check`

### Changesets
- [x] If your PR makes a change that should be noted in one or more packages' changelogs, generate a changeset by running `pnpm changeset` and following the prompts. All changesets should be `patch` until SvelteKit 1.0

body:
@dummdidumm That worked for the props. Thanks. Side note: I really like where this is headed, having been a skeptic of the changes at first. Appreciate your work & patience.

As for the types issue, this seems to be coming up for typescript users (e.g. me, and the folks who raised #6597.) I'm pretty sure it's a VSCode/extensions issue. I'll try some things, but do you guys have an VSCode devcontainer.json, or just a list of extensions, that you could share?

Thank you!

Don't know what you mean by that VSCode devcontainer thing. Svelte files are handled through the Svelte for VS Code extension. There have been other issues raised with this not getting updated properly sometimes, but so far nothing that is reproducible. I'll try myself after things settle down a bit.

I'm experiencing the type issue as well, but I'll need to investigate more to isolate a repro. Iirc from the top of my head: it appeared when the action could return an invalid() response or a plain object `{ success: true }` in different paths. Typescript merged the result type into `any` for whatever reason and that seems to cause ActionData to become unknown.

One more thing, then I'll let this go. 

Looking at a route in my main project, where I originally encountered this issue, here's `ActionData` from `./$types`...
```ts
// .svelte-kit/types/src/routes/(web)/auth/sign-in/$types.d.ts
export type ActionData = Kit.AwaitedActions<typeof import('./proxy+page.server.js').actions>;
```
This is using 472.

After updating the reproduction for this issue to use 473, `ActionData` looks like this:
```ts
// .svelte-kit/types/src/routes/prefs/$types.d.ts
export type ActionData = Kit.AwaitedActions<typeof import('../../../../../src/routes/prefs/+page.server.js').actions>;
```

It doesn't make a difference to whether the types are picked up (either in .svelte or .ts) but it looks like something flaky is happening.

Anyway, cheers.

I'm still seeing type errors on `ActionData` on `1.0.0-next.474`. I have the following form and action: ```svelte {#if form?.success}

Success

{:else}
{/if} ``` ```typescript // src/routes/(site)/contact/+page.server.ts export const actions: Actions = { default() { return { success: true } }, } ``` This appears to actually work correctly, but Typescript isn't happy about it. VSCode is saying the type of `form` is `unknown` and `svelte-check` seems to agree. ``` â†’ npm run check > myhearingsolution.com@0.0.1 check > svelte-kit sync && svelte-check --tsconfig ./tsconfig.json ==================================== Loading svelte-check in workspace: /home/ben/Projects/Personal/myhearingsolution Getting Svelte diagnostics... /home/ben/Projects/Personal/myhearingsolution/src/routes/(site)/contact/+page.svelte:5:12 Error: Property 'success' does not exist on type '{}'. (ts) {#if form?.success}

Success

==================================== svelte-check found 1 error, 0 warnings, and 0 hints ``` --- Digging into the types it appears `type UnpackValidationError = T extends ValidationError ? X : T;` isn't working properly. ```typescript // Expected this to be `{ success: boolean }`, VSCode reports it's actually `unknown` type Test = UnpackValidationError<{ success: boolean }> ```
